already.translation[0].definitions[0].de: before now, or before a particular time
already.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: The design of the new house is similar to those that have already been built.
The performance had already started when we arrived.
already.translation[0].definitions[1].de: used to say that something has been done before and does not need doing again
already.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: ‘Fancy a coffee?’ ‘No thanks, I already have one.’
already.translation[0].definitions[2].de: used to say that something has happened too soon or before the expected time
already.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: Have you eaten all that food already?
already.translation[0].definitions[3].de: used to say that a situation exists and it might get worse, greater etc
already.translation[0].note_box[0].items: Already often comes at the end of a sentence
I have booked the tickets already
As well as at the end of a sentence, already can be used in the following ways
Already can come before a main verb
Already comes after ‘be’ when it is the main verb
Already comes after the first auxiliary verb
I have already booked the tickets
I already have booked the tickets
